Description: Glazed composition bowl; mould-made; thin walls; yellowish core; poorly preserved greenish blue glaze on exterior and interior rim, lower interior now white but may have originally been greenish blue; interior decorated with linear decoration in black paint; horizontal wavy line on rim interior, lower part of body decoration consists of an arc filled with parallel horizontal lines with papyrus branch to either side, hatched triangles framing a solid triangle abutting horizontal line of arc; less than half preserved, remainder of vessel and decoration reconstructed.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No.186)
